intro: Agation rufotomentosum, commonly known as the red-tomentose agate, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are pinnately divided and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Agation rufotomentosum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to arid conditions.
